markdown:
SCOPE & FEASIBILITY (INPUT TO GATE 2) THIS PAGE IS REQUIRED IF QUALITATIVE RESEARCH IS CONDUCTED TYPE OF RESEARCH CONDUCTED: option Internal Focus Groups: [ ] option Consumer Focus Groups: [x] option Consumer Panel: [ ] option Online Qualitative: [ ] option Online Quantitative: [ ] option OTHER (DESCRIBE): [ ] ## PRODUCT CONCEPT TESTED: Explain how the concept was presented to those tested (visual attachments can be included): Consumer workshops with approx 8 respondents and duration of 2 1/2 hours per group [ ] Recruit 12 to get 8 respondents - Age: 21-29 years of adult smokers; (50% between 21-25 years old) - Ethnic: 50% Caucasians, 50% mix of others - Education: all levels - Personal income: Annual salary of $20 000+ - Living: Preference for adult smokers who live in their own flat/house - Working: All respondents work at least 20 hours a week. (Except 3 non working students per group) - Attitude: all respondents with good verbal skills and a pleasure oriented lifestyle Evaluation of the impact on the KOOL brand perception if the current packaging design would be changed. Inputs to the brand communication on the pack:00s, KOOL. - 1 focus groups (female), with regular adult smokers of menthol brands (stand alones and line extension menthol brands) * 50% adult Newport smokers * 50% adult smokers of Marlboro menthol - 1 focus groups (male), with regular adult smokers of Newport - 2 focus groups (1 female, 1 male) with adult occasional menthol smokers * 50% adult Newport smokers * 50% adult smokers of Marlboro menthol - 2 focus groups (mixed gender) with adult KOOL smokers * 1 group with regular adult KOOL smokers * 1 group with adult occasional KOOL smokers (regular brand: normal tobacco **LEARNING RESULTS:** Every effort should be made to gather these pieces of information, so a consistent evaluation occurs across projects:
Mean Rating (10-pt scale)AppealImportance
-Concept
-Product
-Packaging
5 54611 2761 Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/ggmx0225
